subject: Re: [junit] Splitting class from source
msgSnippet: JUnit does not depend on source files.  You are probably using Ant or some other tool to start up JUnit.  The problem is most likely there. Try it straight

JUnit does not depend on source files.  You are probably using Ant or
some other tool to start up JUnit.  The problem is most likely there. 
Try it straight from the command line and see if you get different
results.

=jason

On Wed, 2003-05-14 at 19:54, junitguy wrote:
> I keep my source files in a "src" directory.  When I build with Ant, 
> I compile my class files into a "build" directory.  I would like to 
> then run JUnit tests against the newly created classes in the build 
> directory, but JUnit can't seem to do this unless the .java files are 
> copied there as well.  I've tried setting a classpath to both 
> locations, but this does not solve the problem.  Someone have a good 
> solution to this problem?
> 
>
